org.hps.recon.ecal.cluster

Class ClusterUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hps.recon.ecal.cluster.ClusterUtilities

  • public final class ClusterUtilities
extends Object
    This is a set of simple utility methods for clustering algorithms.
    See Also:
    Cluster, BaseCluster

      Comparator of cluster energies.
      (package private) static class  ClusterUtilities.UniqueEnergyComparator
      Compare CalorimeterHit energies and disambiguate equal values using the crystal position.

      • findHighestEnergyHit

        public static CalorimeterHit findHighestEnergyHit(Cluster cluster)
        Find the hit with the highest energy value. This method doesn't handle hits with the same energy properly. It will simply return the first of them. Use sortReconClusterHits(List) if this level of disambiguation is needed (e.g. in order to find an exact seed hit).
        Parameters:
        cluster - The input cluster.
        Returns:
        The hit with the highest energy value.

      • sortedHits

        public static List<CalorimeterHit> sortedHits(Cluster cluster,
                                              Comparator<CalorimeterHit> comparator,
                                              boolean reverseOrder)
        Sort the hits in the cluster using a Comparator. This method will not change the hits in place. It returns a new list. The algorithm does not disambiguate between hits with equal energies.
        Parameters:
        cluster - The input cluster.
        comparator - The Comparator to use for sorting.
        reverseOrder - True to use reverse rather than default ordering.
        Returns:
        The sorted list of hits.

      • findUnsharedHits

        public static List<CalorimeterHit> findUnsharedHits(Cluster cluster,
                                                    List<Cluster> clusters)
        Find hits in a Cluster that are not shared with other Clusters.
        Parameters:
        cluster - The input cluster.
        clusters - The list of clusters.
        Returns:
        The list of unshared hits.

        clusters - The list of clusters.

        The list of CalorimeterHits that were not clustered.

      • sortReconClusterHits

        public static void sortReconClusterHits(List<Cluster> clusters)
        Sort in place the CalorimeterHit list of a set of clusters, disambiguating when the energies are exactly the same.
        Parameters:
        clusters - The list of clusters with hits to sort.

      • sortHitsUniqueEnergy

        public static void sortHitsUniqueEnergy(List<CalorimeterHit> hits)
        Sort in place a list of hits by their corrected energy. If energy is equal then position is used to disambiguate.
        Parameters:
        hits - The list of hits.

      • getHits

        public static Set<CalorimeterHit> getHits(List<Cluster> clusters)
        Get the set of hits from a list of clusters.
        Parameters:
        clusters - The input cluster list.
        Returns:
        The list of hits from all the clusters.

      • findSharedHits

        public static List<CalorimeterHit> findSharedHits(Cluster cluster)
        This method will determine which hits are likely shared with other clusters, by comparing a hit's energy to its contribution. If the energy is greater than the contribution, then its energy will assumed to be shared between clusters. This convention might not be true depending on the clustering algorithm, but it is probably the best that can be done without the complete list of clusters in the event.
        Parameters:
        cluster - The input cluster.

      • findUnsharedHits

        public static List<CalorimeterHit> findUnsharedHits(Cluster cluster)
        This method will determine which hits are likely not shared other clusters, by comparing a hit's energy to its contribution. If the energy is equal to the contribution, then its energy will assumed to not be shared between clusters. This convention might not be true depending on the clustering algorithm, but it is probably the best that can be done without the complete list of clusters in the event.
        Parameters:
        cluster - The input cluster.

      • isHardwareCluster

        public static boolean isHardwareCluster(Cluster cluster)
        True if cluster has a type code that indicates it was generated by a hardware clustering algorithm. These are not actually hardware clusters but are generated by Driver code that simulates these algorithms.
        Parameters:
        cluster - The Cluster.
        Returns:
        True if cluster is generated from hardware clustering algorithm.

      • sort

        public static List<Cluster> sort(List<Cluster> clusters,
                                 Comparator<Cluster> comparator,
                                 boolean inPlace,
                                 boolean reverse)
        Sort a list of clusters.
        Parameters:
        clusters - the list of clusters
        comparator - the comparator to use for sorting
        inPlace - true to sort the list in-place and not make a new list
        reverse - true to use reverse comparator (results in list ordered highest to lowest energy)
        Returns:
        the sorted list of clusters

        Returns:
        the highest energy cluster
